title: Solutions Architect Principal (US-Based Remote Flexibility)
description:
**The Opportunity**

As a Solutions Architect/Pre-Sale Engineer, you will be responsible for developing digital solutions to respond to RFXs with an emphasis on AI solutions. You will focus on delivering IT systems and data products that inform program evaluation, implementation, and agency operations. In this role, you will blend knowledge of federal programs and IT systems to design, develop, and deliver solutions and teams with a high level of quality, resiliency, and timeliness. You will work closely with the capture and market teams to understand client requirements and provide technical support during the sales process. You will be involved with preparing product demonstrations, technical presentations, orals, proposal responses, and managing relationships with clients in the government sector. The role is critical in ensuring that our solutions align with the needs of government contracts and are technically feasible.

**Core Responsibilities**

* Assist the sales team by providing technical expertise during the sales process. Collaborate with capture managers and portfolio teams to identify customer needs and propose suitable solutions with an emphasis on AI.

* Understand and comply with government contracting regulations, requirements, and procurement processes (e.g., FAR, DFARS, 508 Compliance).

* Work with internal teams to design and customize solutions based on government customer specifications. Participate in preparing and reviewing proposals, responding to RFPs (Request for Proposals), RFQs (Request for Quotes), and other solicitation documents.

* Conduct live product demonstrations, technical briefings, and presentations to potential government clients. Tailor demos to address the specific needs of each client.

* Prepare and review technical documentation, including system architecture diagrams, technical specifications, and user manuals for government clients.

* Collaborate with clients, project managers, product managers, and engineers to ensure that customer requirements are understood and met.

* Engage with government clients to gather detailed requirements and assess technical feasibility of proposed solutions.

* Stay updated on industry trends, competitor solutions, and government procurement processes. Use this knowledge to support sales strategies.

* Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure all solutions proposed meet compliance, security, and regulatory standards specific to government contracts.

**What We Value**

* Bachelor’s Degree + Fifteen years of relevant experience, or master's degree + Twelve years of relevant experience, or PhD + Ten years of relevant experience; Experience may be substituted for education.

* 10+ years of progressive experience in sales-oriented client relationship management role, technical professional services delivery, in professional services and government or government contracting.

* Experience working with key clients in DoD, DHS, VA and/or Military Health for 5+ years.

* Solid understanding of hardware/software solutions, system integration, cloud services, cybersecurity, networking, and IT infrastructure. Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

* Strong collaborator with a history of maintaining successful relationships internally and externally. Prior experience working in highly collaborative, highly matrixed environments is desired.

* Excellent presentation, writing, and verbal communication skills. Ability to present to high-level government officials and decision-makers.

* Ability to assess customer needs and provide tailored, innovative solutions.

* Bachelor’s Degree in related field or discipline.

* Familiarity with government contracting processes, including GSA schedules, federal and state procurement processes, and compliance with regulations such as ITAR, NIST, FISMA, and CMMC.

* Deep familiarity with how the US federal government conducts business, along with experience throughout the federal sales cycle, to position, win, and grow business.

* US work authorization with no sponsorship required.

* Ability to gain or maintain US government security clearance.

**What We Offer**

We foster an environment where you can Thrive Your Way. Our innovative total rewards programs are designed to help balance your work and personal life. The approach toward your wellbeing centers around comprehensive benefits, flexible schedules, and professional development.

Abt Global Inc. is an Equal Opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse workforce. Abt provides market-competitive salaries and comprehensive employee benefits.

This position offers an anticipated annual base salary range of approximately $186,000 to $240,000 and may vary by ten percent depending on candidate geographic location. Salary offers are made based on internal equity and market analysis.

*Disclaimer: Abt will never ask candidates for money in exchange for an offer of employment.*

#LI-SH1

  

Abt Global is a mission-driven, global leader in research and program implementation in the fields of health, social and environmental policy, and international development. Known for its rigorous approach to solving complex challenges, Abt Global is regularly ranked as one of the top global research firms and one of the international development innovators. The company has multiple offices in the U.S. and program offices in more than 40 countries.

title: Systems and Solutions Engineer
description:
**Building the people that build the world.**

With platforms in HVAC and Detection and Measurement, SPX Technologies builds innovative solutions that enable a safer, more efficient, sustainable world. Through our RiSE talent development framework, we Reach, Identify, Strengthen, and Engage our employees to support them in their continued development. We’re a global company of problem solvers, collaborators, and innovators, and our businesses build solutions that impact the world.

  

As part of Detection and Measurement, Aids to Navigation, including Flash, Sabik Marine and Sealite, are leading providers of lighting and navigational aids for the marine, obstruction, and airfield end markets. Offering the broadest portfolio of solutions, we help people transverse the world safely by air, land, and sea.

  

This role covers both systems engineering and product integration engineering, as well as providing technical stakeholder support to meet client and/or employer needs for the business.

  

**Duties:**

  

* Deliver system design and product integration, including assistance with test and commissioning of new equipment.

* Deliver new product introduction, by working with engineering and production staff to ensure successful pilot and production introduction.

* Inform relevant personnel of changes to design and/or scope that may impact deadlines, workloads, or assignments of the team or project.

* Provide technical support and input for tender preparation.

* Develop custom system solutions in response to stakeholder requirements and responding to technical sales queries (e.g. solar sizing, mechanical interfaces, electrical parameters, etc).

* Develop existing systems by analysis and identifying areas for modification.

* Maintain and improve systems by monitoring, identifying and correcting system or and/or product defects.

* Become familiar with all products, or develop the necessary channels required to gather any requested information.

* Become familiar with all relevant industry standards (e.g. FAA, ICAO, IALA, REACH, RoHS, RED) and mandatory regulations.

* Create technical specifications and test plans.

* Develop and write detailed Scope of work documents.

* Write operational documentation.

* Work closely with other staff contributing to company objectives, such as development engineers, quality engineers, production staff, project managers, graphic artists, systems analysts, and sales and marketing professionals.

* Constantly updating technical knowledge and skills by attending in-house and/or external courses, reading manuals and accessing new applications.

* Participate in department improvement activities such as reviewing and updating engineering processes.

* The role may require occasional travel to site and/or our global offices.

* Perform any other duties as reasonably directed.

  

**Minimum Position Requirements:**

* BS Electrical Engineering
* 3 years+ experience in a Systems Engineering position
* Experience in environmental, electrical, and RF compliance verification or testing
* Proven experience in the end to end the design of a product or project
* Ability to read and understand electronic and mechanical documentation
* Experience in 2D drafting packages
* Advanced MS Office experience
* Excellent communications skills
* Organization and time management to manage multiple, and at times, shifting priorities.
* Demonstrated critical thinking skills, capable of making evidence based technical and business decisions
* Confident and motivated, uses initiative, perseverance, independence and resilience to drive outcomes

  

**How we live our culture**

Our culture is at the center of what we do and, more importantly, who we are. Our core values set a standard for how we manage ourselves, and our Leadership Model sets the standard for how we engage with each other. Whether you are an individual contributor or you lead a large team, each of us leads at SPX.

  

**What benefits do we offer?**

We know that the well-being of our employees is integral. Our benefits include:

* Competitive and performance-based compensation packages and bonus plans
* Educational assistance, leadership development programs, and recognition programs
  

**Our commitment to embrace diversity to build a culture of inclusion at SPX**

We value different backgrounds, experiences, and voices at SPX, and we are committed to challenging ourselves, openly communicating, and striving to improve every day. We believe in creating an inclusive work environment where everyone has a voice and is encouraged to realise their fullest potential.
company_description: At SPX Technologies, we’re driven by ingenuity with a focus on meeting our customers’ needs.

title: Principal Solutions Engineer, Strategic DACH (German Speaking)
description:
**Working at Atlassian**

Atlassians can choose where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.

**Your future team**

Our Solutions Engineering Team is comprised of people with backgrounds in pre-sales, consulting and engineering. We partner with the Enterprise Sales Team & Channel Partners to understand the needs of Atlassian's customers, strategise on enterprise sales cycles, provide value-based demonstrations and support Proofs of Value to ultimately allow our customers to unleash the potential of their teams.

**In this role, you will:**

* Conduct thorough customer discovery to assess challenges, business goals, and technical requirements, uncovering opportunities for cross-product and solution expansion aligned with Atlassian’s offerings.
* Deliver tailored, engaging product demonstrations that address customer objections, connect technical capabilities to business needs, and use storytelling techniques to align with the customer’s vision of success.
* Develop proof-of-concept environments and lead interactive workshops to showcase product features, workflows, and hands-on solutions aligned with customer goals.
* Continuously enhance technical expertise by staying updated on Atlassian’s roadmap, pursuing certifications, and refining pre-sales knowledge, product offerings, and sales processes.
* Collaborate with internal teams, account managers, and product stakeholders to drive transformation deals, identify growth opportunities, and ensure seamless communication and alignment with customer objectives.
* Build a robust understanding of competitors’ offerings to clearly articulate Atlassian’s differentiators in competitive scenarios.
* Experiment with innovative approaches to pre-sales activities, such as gamification or audience participation, to enhance customer engagement.
* Be fluent in German and English

**Your background:**

* 6+ years of experience in sales engineering, with at least four years covering large strategic accounts.
* Experience communicating and presenting to senior stakeholders across various levels of an organization, including extensive engagement with executive leadership.
* You're proactive, passionate, and thrive on collaboration to drive meaningful results. Our team embraces a solutions-oriented mindset—so if you're looking for a passive role, this position may not be the right fit.
* Outstanding communication skills across oral, written, and presentation formats, paired with a knack for building genuine and lasting relationships.
* Curious, solutions-focused, and passionate about technology and empowering others through knowledge sharing.
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field; MBA or advanced technical degree preferred
* Willing and able to travel occasionally

**Benefits & Perks**

Atlassian offers a wide range of perks and benefits designed to support you, your family and to help you engage with your local community. Our offerings include health and wellbeing resources, paid volunteer days, and so much more. To learn more, visit **go.atlassian.com/perksandbenefits****.**

**About Atlassian**

At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team. Our software products help teams all over the planet and our solutions are designed for all types of work. Team collaboration through our tools makes what may be impossible alone, possible together.

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

To provide you the best experience, we can support with accommodations or adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process. Simply inform our Recruitment team during your conversation with them.

To learn more about our culture and hiring process, visit **go.atlassian.com/crh****.**
company_description: Atlassian is committed to unleashing the potential of every team, helping them accomplish what’s impossible alone.

title: Technical Solutions Consultant
description:
**About Pantheon**

Pantheon WebOps Platform powers the open web, running more than 300,000 sites in the cloud for customers including Google, Princeton, Salesloft, and Doctors Without Borders. Every day, thousands of developers and marketers create, iterate, and scale WordPress and Drupal sites to reach billions of people globally. Pantheon's multitenant, container-based platform enables organizations to manage all of their websites from a single dashboard. Organizations, including Clorox and the United Nations, drive results through accelerated development and real-time publishing using Pantheon's collaborative workflows.

### **The Role**

Pantheon's customers build complex open-source web applications that drive donations, run businesses, publish breaking news, and empower local communities. The Technical Solutions Consulting (TSC) team is responsible for the strategic technical success of these customers. We accomplish this by serving as trusted strategic partners, engaging on a consultative level to ensure that there are no technical blockers to our customers achieving the goals that brought them to Pantheon.

**This is a remote position open to candidates based in the United States or in Canada (Toronto, ON, or Vancouver, BC).**

### **What You Need to Succeed**

* 5+ years of experience as a Technical Account Manager, Solutions Architect, or equivalent role, managing technical relationships with customers and accountable for driving adoption and helping customers grow and evolve.
* Strong technical background, with a solid understanding of web development, hosting, and related technologies.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and trust with customers.
* Ability to analyze technical data and identify trends, risks, and opportunities.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot technical issues and find effective solutions.
* Ability to manage multiple accounts and priorities effectively.

### **What You Bring To The Table**

* Experience with the Pantheon platform.
* Experience with and understanding of git workflows, hosting stacks, cloud architecture, Drupal/WordPress architecture, edge delivery, decoupled frameworks, CI / automation / devops, high - performance architectures, infosec, etc. Should have specialist knowledge in multiple areas.
* Experience across multiple technical roles, with exposure to a breadth of development contexts and industry verticals (agency, EDU, .gov, advocacy, corporate, small business).
* Ability to run discovery sessions, translate customer requirements into a project plan, and coordinate support across teams to successfully deliver.
* Ability to discuss business drivers, commercial aspects of the customer's web business, and financial impact of risk and recommendations.
* Experience working with global development teams.
* Training and documentation experience.

### **What You Will Do**

* Act as the primary technical point of contact for assigned accounts, building strong relationships with key stakeholders.
* Manage the technical aspects of the customer relationship, ensuring customer satisfaction and retention.
* Proactively identify and mitigate technical risks and issues, working closely with support and engineering teams.
* Provide technical guidance and support to customers, helping them optimize their use of the Pantheon platform.
* Conduct regular technical account reviews, analyzing performance metrics, identifying trends, and providing recommendations for improvement.
* Develop and maintain technical account plans, outlining key objectives, success metrics, and strategies for achieving customer goals.
* Collaborate with Customer Success Managers and other internal teams to ensure a seamless customer experience.
* Assist with onboarding new customers, providing technical training and guidance.
* Identify and communicate opportunities for account growth and upsell.
* Manage and resolve technical escalations, ensuring timely and effective resolution.

### **What We Offer**

We have all the usual perks and benefits, but what we can really offer you is a fantastic work environment powered by an amazing team.

* Industry-competitive compensation and equity plan
* Time off to recharge
  + *US:* Flexible time off, sick days, and 13 paid holidays
  + *Canada:* Paid time off (PTO), paid sick leave (PSL), and 11 paid holidays
* Comprehensive medical coverage: health, dental, vision
* Paid parental leave (plus fertility, adoption, and other family planning benefits)
* In-office workspace available in San Francisco (US) and Vancouver (Canada)
* Top-of-the-line equipment and tools
* Monthly allowance for wellness, reading, and access to LinkedIn Learning for continued development
* Team-based and company-wide events and activities that inspire, educate, and cultivate

Pantheon is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law. Pantheon complies with federal and local disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If you need reasonable accommodation due to a disability for any part of the interview process, please contact talent@pantheon.io. Pursuant to local and federal regulations, Pantheon will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.

**Compensation:**

The base salary range for this role is as follows:

* **United States:** $100,000-$119,000
* **Vancouver, BC & Toronto, ON (Canada):** CAD 108,000-128,000

*This position also offers a performance bonus dependent on company performance. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location.*

United States: After an offer is made and accepted, E-Verify will be used to confirm your identity and employment eligibility, as required by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.

Visa sponsorship is not available at this time.

To review the Employee and Applicant's Privacy Policy, click here.
company_description: Pantheon’s mission is to make the open web a first-class platform that delivers results. We believe this is necessary for an interconnected world to be a healthy, thriving, humane place.

title: Senior Newline Client Solutions Engineer
description:
Make banking a Fifth Third better®  
  
We connect great people to great opportunities. Are you ready to take the next step? Discover a career in banking at Fifth Third Bank.

GENERAL FUNCTION

The Senior Client Solutions Engineer will lead the technical solutions process, acting as a technical liaison between the Sales Team, Clients, and Internal Stakeholders during the onboarding process to ensure a deep understanding of client needs and demonstrate how our solutions can meet those needs effectively. This role will meet directly with clients to ensure their technical integration with our offerings is seamless. A blend of technical knowledge and strong communication skills is key to effectively convey the benefits of our product and services, identifying gaps ensuring successful onboarding of clients.

Responsible and accountable for risk by openly exchanging ideas and opinions, elevating concerns, and personally following policies and procedures as defined. Accountable for always doing the right thing for customers and colleagues and ensures that actions and behaviors drive a positive customer experience. While operating within the Bank's risk appetite, achieves results by consistently identifying, assessing, managing, monitoring, and reporting risks of all types.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

* API Onboarding & Integration Support: Once the client is ready to move to onboarding, the Solutions Engineer will provide technical guidance on API integration, including Use Case documentation, troubleshooting during onboarding to ensure a smooth implementation and operational success for clients.

* Solution Design: Analyze client requirements to design customized solutions that integrate seamlessly with their existing systems and meet their business objectives. This role will also work closely with our Product and Engineering teams on future enhancements and client requests.

* Industry Knowledge: Understand payments, banking, fintech, and API technologies to provide up-to-date insights and solutions.

* Documentation: Consistent documentation of Use Cases and funds flows while working with clients to identify gaps in product requirements or processes.

* Client Interaction: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients during onboarding, offering expert advice and resolving any technical issues or concerns they may have.

* Technical Consulting: Participate as needed on Sales calls to provide technical solutions consulting focused on our API and Payments products.

* Product Feedback and Improvement: Collect feedback from clients to identify potential product enhancements and work closely with the development team to influence product evolution.

* Documentation/Writing: Must have experience with writing requirements.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

May serve as a mentor for junior talent on the team and assist in onboarding/training.

MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED

* Education: bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent work experience. Master’s degree or equivalent advanced certification preferred.

* Experience: 5-8 years of relevant work experience including solutions, development, API integrations. Experience in Fintech, Payments or Banking preferred.

* Technical Skills: In-depth knowledge of payments systems, banking technology, and API integrations. Familiarity with relevant compliance standards is a plus.

* Candidate should have a deep, working knowledge of RESTful API's, HTTP, SSL/TLS, webhooks, websockets and asynchronous vs synchronous processing. A CS background or prior development experience is preferred.

* Experience reading, writing, and using OpenAPI Specification 3.0+ a plus.

* Communication: Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal), with the ability to convey complex technical concepts in a clear and engaging manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.

* Leadership: Prior leadership experience preferred.

* Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail and a proactive approach to addressing client needs.

* Collaboration: Proven ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, including sales, product, and engineering departments.

* Experience with CRM and sales enablement tools preferred.

* Knowledge of financial regulations and standards (e.g., PCI-DSS, GDPR preferred.

* Certifications related to payments, fintech, or API technologies preferred.

title: Product Specialist / Solutions Engineer
description:
We are looking for a haku technology expert to join our sales and marketing team as a **Product Specialist / Solutions Engineer**. The ideal candidate will utilize their product knowledge to provide cross-functional support to sales, marketing, product, and customer experience, providing key support and communication about the product’s functions, customer insights, and more.

  

**YOUR LIFE AT HAKU**

Our state of the art, stunning offices overlooking Biscayne Bay in Miami are home to a diverse, thoughtful, and dynamic group of passionate professionals. We thrive on solving challenges, fostering strong relationships with our customers, creating innovative technology, and winning together as a team - we think you’ll love it too!

**As a Team Member, You'll Be Eligible To Benefit From:**

* Flexible PTO + paid holidays
* Top-quality benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, and Life Insurance)
* 401k with employer matching (after 90 days)
* Parental Leave: paid parental leave for birthing and non-birthing parents (after 1 year)
* Professional Development Reimbursement (after 6 months)
* Monthly credit towards wellness activities (gym, meal plans, mental health costs)
* Free access to wellness subscriptions, mental health and financial planning platforms
* Discounted rates for pet insurance, voluntary life insurance and exclusive employee discounts through Perkspot
* Company-paid parking in the heart of Brickell
* State-of-the-art Apple computer and accessories
* Wellness activities, happy hours, and company-wide fun events
* Top-of-the-line office facilities, including an on-site gym and wellness center, fully stocked kitchen, and more

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**

* **Product Mastery:** Develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of our product offerings, including features, benefits, and differentiators. Stay updated on the latest product developments and industry trends, and assist in creating sales assets that need a knowledgeable product lead (like demo videos, etc.). You will play a pivotal role in engaging with customer stakeholders, presenting our product vision and roadmap with confidence and clarity.
* **Industry Knowledge:** Gain and maintain a thorough understanding of the industry in which we operate. Leverage this knowledge to contextualize our solutions and articulate their value in relation to customer needs.
* **Customer Use Cases:** Become an expert on customer use cases and success stories. Use this knowledge to craft tailored demos and presentations that resonate with different customer segments to support the sales team.
* **Technical Expertise:** Master the "know-how" to effectively communicate the technical aspects of our product to both technical and non-technical audiences. Collaborate with the product team to understand technical nuances and how they translate into customer benefits, and providing enablement to our CX and Sales teams when new features are rolled out.
* **Sales Support:** Work closely with the sales team to provide product demonstrations, technical support during sales calls, and assist in the development of proposals and presentations. Help the sales team close deals by showcasing the value of our solutions.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Collaborate with various teams, including product management, sales, customer experience, and marketing, to ensure that product messaging is consistent and that customer needs are being met. Share customer and industry insights gathered from your collaboration with the CX/Sales team back to the Product Team so we can continue to innovate and remain competitive. Additionally, you’ll support product marketing in the product knowledge needs of GTM campaigns.
* **Customer Experience:** Support the customer experience team by providing product knowledge and technical support as needed. Assist in the onboarding of new customers by ensuring they understand how to use our products effectively.
* **Revenue Growth:** Ultimately, contribute to driving revenue and winning new business by effectively supporting sales and customer experience initiatives. You will serve as the in/external product expert resource to provide detailed product information, best practices, and educational content through customer meetings and online communities.

  

**WHO YOU ARE**

* Strong Collaborator and Team Player
* Problem-Solver and Critical Thinker
* Strong Leadership Skills and Influence
* Time Management and Prioritization
* Creative thinker and Innovator
* Comfortable with being highly adaptable and flexible in a fast-paced, start-up environment
* SaaS Sales, Customer Success, or Product experience is preferred
* Experience (and ideally technical proficiency) in any of the following is preferred: CRM, E-commerce, Fundraising, Payment Processing, Complex Endurance Events
* Self-Starter with an excellent ability for problem-solving and intellectual curiosity to seek out answers until a topic is fully comprehended
* College education in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications preferred. Masters Degree preferred but not required.

**MORE ABOUT HAKU**  
  
haku is a state-of-the-art technology platform that powers world-renowned events. Our SaaS product equips event organizers of all sizes with an impactful business platform that enables them to plan, organize, promote, and execute their events. The bulk of our customers make up the enterprise tier of our market and include organizations like the Marine Corps Marathon, runDisney, The Philadelphia Eagles, the Bank of America Chicago Marathon, Houston Marathon, the Big Sur Marathon, Team in Training, Lexus Corporate Run, and many more.

We’re proud to be a minority owned-business and equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. Our vision as an employer is to establish a work environment where everyone is welcomed, and anyone has the right to succeed

For more information about our company, please visit our website at www.hakuapp.com/careers

  
Flexible work from home options available.

title: Presales Solutions Architect
description:
*Remote Opportunity*

  

**About Convr:**  
Convr is an AI underwriting, data, and intelligent document processing workbench that drives world-class customer experiences. It delivers premium growth, insights and efficiency for commercial P&C insurance organizations of all sizes, including many top carriers, MGA's, Brokers and Reinsurers. Founded in 2016, Convr is solving the greatest challenges of commercial insurance organizations. With rapid advancements in technology, Commercial Insurance Carriers, MGA’s, and Brokers are falling short on technology enablement and efficiency deliverance. Outdated business processes, inaccurate data and technologies are holding them back from elevating and delivering on better customer experience. In addition, this is adding time and costs to doing business, increasing expense ratios and manual entry errors.

With Convr, commercial P&C insurers manage the underwriting process from submission to quote with an on-demand software platform with its purpose-built Artificial Intelligence decisioning engine, empowering them to make better decisions, faster. Our vision is to transform the world through data, discovery, decision, and we do that today by empowering commercial insurers with a core underwriting management solution enabling a frictionless experience, delivering superior performance, optimal efficiency, and world-class customer engagement from submission to quote. You can make a difference in the commercial and property insurance industry by joining and leading to digitally transform commercial insurance with modern AI.

  

**Role Overview:**Convr is growing, and we are looking for a Pre-Sales Industry Consultant who will be the customer-facing subject matter expert (SME) on our Business Development team. The Industry Consultant is instrumental in the sales cycle and account relationship, bringing their technical and industry expertise to create compelling solutions for customers. As an Industry Consultant you will lead the development of customer-specific solutions based on their requirements and positive business outcomes; lead and guide pilot engagements; and be the SME of “frictionless underwriting.” You will present and demonstrate Convr AI to customers and differentiate how Convr AI can uniquely deliver their desired future state and positive business outcomes. You will partner closely with our Business Development Executives (BDEs) to uncover a customer’s current and future state in order to roadmap a prescribed solution. Internal and external stakeholders will view you as a key strategic advisor and you are as comfortable in front of a screen as you are with a whiteboard. You will be a clear communicator who can command a room from C-suite down to practitioner. This role reports to our Director of Business Development Solutions.

  

**Who You Are:**

  

* Action-oriented and proactive in engaging with both customers, Business Development, and other internal colleagues
* Experienced in the business issues and opportunities faced by C-level commercial insurance executives, with a focus on Underwriting & Operations, and can deliver value in 1x1 and group discussions with these executives
* Data-driven and Creative thinker, with strong passion for serving Insurance clients in their effort to successfully transform their business
* Curious, seeking to understand, and comfortable asking questions to the customer
* Deep interest in and knowledge of emerging trends impacting/likely to impact insurers, distributors, and customers
* Value proposition development and articulation
* Business capability realization solution and roadmap development
* Proven ability to work creatively and analytically, with a team, in a problem-solving environment
* Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
* Methodical and meticulous approach to preparation and execution
* Self-starter with little need for oversight and a positive attitude

  

What You'll be Doing: Industry Consultants partner with the BDE to attain their revenue goals by ‘owning the functional & technical win’ as key member of the account team through:

* Architecting compelling solutions to address a customer’s key operations and underwriting challenges, presenting a desired future state, and delivering a competitive advantage with measurable outcomes:
  + Lead and document discovery sessions to understand the client's business objectives and desired outcomes; this includes asking the customer relevant questions and guiding the solutioning process with both the customer and Business Development team
  + Present a vision of the solution, meeting the client's requirements that will drive adoption and growth; this includes presenting the Convr AI Feature Overview and opening dialogue with the customer to understand their current state/desired future state/requirements; also includes configuring specific Discovery Demonstration based on customer requirements (as needed) and changing talk track to tailor to each customer
  + Demonstrate Convr AI to prospective and current customers, utilizing various types of demo formats based on the prospect/customer situation
  + Lead client workshops which may include whiteboarding, Q&A sessions, and trials
  + Solutioning includes carriers, MGAs/MGUs, brokers; standard lines and specialty lines
* Being the SME in “Frictionless Underwriting:”
  + Share how Convr can help C-level executives drive positive business outcomes with Convr AI – this includes painting the vision of frictionless UW for the client, storytelling using other customer examples, and whiteboarding solutions with executives
  + Developing go-to-market content for external and internal use that will be used by the Business Development team to build pipeline and accelerate active sales opportunities
  + Becoming a Convr product/module SME, showcasing the details of the Convr platform
  + Keep current on industry trends and competition
  + Continuously leverage internal learning and competitive intelligence
  + Understand the commercial insurance industry, department verticals, and challenges facing specific buyer personas within Convr’s target market
  + Develop a repertoire of client stories to convey the value of Convr’s solution to the customer, enabling champions to tell stories on our behalf
  + Sharpen the saw on pre-sales skills, as well as participating and attending trade events.
* Governing the Convr AI Demo Environment
  + Lead the stabilization & sizzle efforts in the demo environment(s)/client(s) so Convr delivers reliable, relevant and inspiring demos.
  + Ensure system upgrades are tested and environment is ready for demos when complete.
* Collaboration and Administration
  + Communicate progress and expectations, escalating problems to leaders for awareness and/or resolution
  + Prioritize participation in meetings with the Business Development team
  + As needed, assist and/or participate with pilots utilizing customer pilot data.
  + Ensure general administration across our systems of record are timely and accurate
  + Provide prompt and detailed handoffs to Customer Success (CS) to deliver against the proposed solution
  + Document observations from prospects and customers to influence future product capabilities

* + Create re-usable collateral for the entire global presales team and acts as a mentor to those across other teams.

* Responsible for Coordinating RFx responses.

  

**Role Requirement:**

  

* Bachelor’s Degree from a credited university or college
* Familiarity with Python and Java (coding, tweaking, understanding)
* Experience working on a Platform oriented architecture and working with databases
* 5+ years of experience with, and deep knowledge of, commercial P&C insurance products, services, channels, functions, and processes (particularly Underwriting & Operations)
* 5+ years of experience in a presales role at a SaaS company managing large enterprise customers OR 5+ years of experience working in a Commercial P&C company with operations and underwriting technology.

  

**Why Join Convr?**

* Full Transparency. We believe in open communication with our team and clients.
* Excellent work-life balance. We believe in flexibly because "life" happens!
* Team mentality. We believe in "All Hands-on Deck"! Helping one another regardless of department.
* Everyone knows your name. We are a high growth, dynamic, entrepreneurial company comprised of passionate team members committed to changing the commercial insurance industry. You will not be just a number!
* We believe in challenging yourself to develop your career.
* We are going places! We have a passionate team taking Convr to the next level!

  

**Benefits & Compensation**

* Remote work
* Flexible Paid Time Off
* Company Paid Holidays
* Insurance Coverage (medical, dental, vision, short-term & long-term disability, life insurance, and accident coverage)
* 401K
* Paid Parental Leave
* The annual salary for this role falls within the range of $120,000 to $175,000. The final compensation will be determined based on factors such as location, experience, education, skills, and industry knowledge.

475 N. Martingale Rd, Suite 1050
Schaumburg, IL 60173
company_description: Convr helps commercial P&C insurers achieve frictionless underwriting.

title: Boomi Solution Architect
description:
Join a company that’s leading the way in AI and automation consulting. Our portfolio encompasses over 10 top technologies across business applications, data, processes, cloud, and AI. At Bits In Glass, you’ll do meaningful work with a supportive, driven team that loves to collaborate and celebrate wins together. Whether you’re coding, consulting or bringing bold ideas to the table, you’ll tackle real business challenges, grow your skills, and make a BIG impact.

At Bits In Glass (BIG), we’re redefining digital transformation through AI, cloud, and automation. With expertise across 10+ top enterprise platforms, we help clients integrate data, automate processes, and modernize applications. Whether you’re architecting solutions or shaping pre-sales strategy, you’ll make an immediate impact—supported by a collaborative culture recognized globally as a Great Place to Work.

If you’re a technical leader with Boomi expertise and a passion for solving complex challenges, BIG could be the place for you.

Responsibilities:

* Solution Architecture & Delivery
  + Lead end-to-end solution design using Boomi, integrating into broader enterprise data and process architectures.
  + Estimate effort, create technical documentation, and drive sophisticated Boomi implementations hands-on.
  + Conduct detailed Boomi code reviews and optimize solution design for performance, maintainability, and reuse.
  + Mentor junior developers and support delivery teams with architectural guidance and best practices.
* Pre-Sales Engineering and Partner Support
  + Collaborate with Sales to support discovery, technical demos, RFPs, and value realization for prospects and clients.
  + Build and present solution prototypes that demonstrate Boomi’s value across industry use cases.
  + Advise client technical teams—including architects and developers—on platform fit, scalability, and integrations.
  + Act as a technical thought leader and trusted advisor during account growth conversations.
* Strategic & Cross-Functional Collaboration
  + Support AI/ML/GenAI integration initiatives by working closely with internal data science and engineering teams.
  + Stay current with Boomi platform updates, industry trends, and competitive iPaaS offerings (e.g., MuleSoft, TIBCO, Informatica).
  + Participate in product feedback loops, sharing insights from field experience with Boomi and platform teams.
  + Contribute to reusable assets, accelerators, and frameworks for future engagements.

Required Skills & Experience

* + 10+ years in a customer-facing architecture, consulting, or pre-sales engineering role.
  + 5+ years of direct hands-on experience with the Boomi platform; minimum 3 Boomi certifications.
  + Deep understanding of iPaaS, middleware, API management, and enterprise architecture patterns.
  + Experience integrating with platforms such as NetSuite, ServiceNow, SAP, or legacy systems.
  + Proficiency in SQL and at least one development language (e.g., Python, Java, Scala, R).
  + Familiarity with public cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) and microservices/API-based systems.
  + Strong communication and stakeholder management skills—able to convey complex topics to both technical and business audiences.

* Nice to Haves
  + Experience with AI/ML integrations or GenAI applications.
  + Prior vendor, SI, or channel partner experience in technical enablement.
  + A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a quantitative field.
  + Understanding of Boomi Flow, B2B/EDI, or Master Data Hub is a plus.

  

Our growing team has earned global recognition as a Great Place to Work and has received multiple industry partner awards, all while maintaining a fun and people-focused culture. If you’re looking to deepen your expertise and solve real-world problems, Bits In Glass could be the place for you. BIG offers remote work options, competitive compensation plans and professional development and learning opportunities.

BIG is a high-growth Cloud Consulting firm with offices in Edmonton, Calgary, Toronto, Denver, Dallas, India and the United Kingdom. Our clients are in Canada, the UK, India and the US. We are a team of experienced IT professionals specializing in delivering business value to organizations that leverage modern platforms, including Pega, Appian, MuleSoft, and Boomi. Our extensive experience in the IT industry, combined with our current track record in enterprise software development, enables us to offer a comprehensive range of services to our clients. Bits In Glass helps organizations of all sizes to automate their businesses and leverage the power of the web and mobile technologies.

title: Solutions Architect (Job Req #2025-283)
description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  
**Job overview:**  
The Solutions Architect is a critical member of the North American Technical Solutions team. This role serves as a key technical resource, demonstrating expert-level knowledge of Ross Video's products and solutions. The Solutions Architect is responsible for scoping and designing complex technical solutions tailored to meet customer requirements across North America and within multiple verticals including traditional broadcast, government, education, corporate and house of worship.
  
This position requires a unique blend of solution architecture expertise, customer-facing "soft" skills, and pre-sales experience. The Solutions Architect regularly interacts with prospects, partners, consultants, as well as internal teams—such as sales, product development, project management, and technical support—to ensure that the solutions specified are both supported and maintainable.
  
  
**Who you report to:** Manager, Technical Solutions – North America
  
  
**What we offer:**  
Ross offers competitive salaries, comprehensive health plans, and several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, an employee share ownership program, development support, and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we've got an energizing environment here.
  
  
**What the job is all about:**  

* Participates and contributes to sales opportunities driven by the Business Development Managers and Regional Sales Managers, prioritizing efforts based on maximizing total impact on the team's productivity.
* Design and review solutions based on technical RFP/Tender specifications.
* Develop and review highly customized, scalable solution architectures that address intricate customer specifications and set new standards for technical excellence in the Broadcast and Corporate industries, as they relate to signal processing.
* Coordinates closely with Ross' internal Sales team and business partners to design solutions to meet customers' business requirements.
* Engages in customer-facing product presentations, demos, training, and workflow guidance to end-users and business partners at customer premises or tradeshows.
* Pre-sales technical engineering and project management.
* Ensures the product line's sales and marketing follow the Ross Video Code of Ethics.
* Works on systems-oriented and highly technical projects.
* Creates conceptual sales drawings that capture the spirit of specific opportunities while also creating general variations for use by other groups at Ross.
* Assists sales team during project discovery calls.
* Helps to prepare world-class customer-facing proposal supplements.
* Acts as a "Technical Evangelist" to help build trust and inspiration with our partners and customers.
* Provides client feedback to product teams regarding product & application requirements.

**Who you are:**  

* College Degree in Production Technology or Engineering, Video Production, Broadcasting, or a related discipline (equivalent work experience in a B2B pre-sales engineering role or Solution Architect role will also be considered).
* 5+ years of combined sales, sales engineering, systems application, product specialist, or end-user experience.
* Deep knowledge of pre-sales engineering principles, methods, practices and techniques.
* Familiarity and demonstrated ability to navigate Request for Proposal and Tender documents.
* Strong understanding of Media Workflows, newsroom production workflow and content management systems.
* Working knowledge of graphics systems, playback servers, production switchers, video scalers, video routers, device control protocols, and their roles in various applications.
* Experience selling Broadcast & Live Product equipment and services (existing knowledge and use of Ross Video products preferred).
* Practical knowledge of the broadcast and live production industry, including familiarity with key components used in broadcast electronics applications, industry-standard protocols (including SMPTE 2110 IP and its implementation), product lines, key accounts, and competitors of Ross Video.
* Record of achievement and technical solution expertise in a customer-facing environment.
* Advanced skill set using Visio as well as AutoCAD.
* Experienced user of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and CAD, with a strong track record of producing complex technical drawings with consistency and accuracy.
* Proficient in both Desktop and Server Networking practices.
* Experienced user of commercial quoting platforms and sales tools, including CRM software (ideally Salesforce.com).
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills; written, in-person and virtually.
* Strong and creative problem-solving skills.
* Calm under pressure with the ability to meet deadlines in a fast paced, dynamic environment.
* Strong organizational and communication skills across all mediums.
* Exhibits an extreme attention to detail.
* Self-motivated, with the desire to work independently.
* Desire to constructively contribute to a positive team environment.

**Other:**  

* Valid passport and willingness to travel internationally to customer sites and/or major tradeshows and events.

#LI-Remote
  
  
Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

title: Customer Solution Engineer
description:
Company Overview

At Zuora, we do Modern Business. We're helping people subscribe to new ways of doing business that are better for people, companies and ultimately the planet. It's an approach resulting from the shift to the Subscription Economy that puts customers first by building recurring relationships instead of one-time product sales and focuses on sustainable growth. Through our leading expertise and multi-product suite, we are transforming all industries and working with the world's most innovative companies to monetize new business models, nurture subscriber relationships and optimize their digital experiences.

  

The Team & Role

Our growth story is only just beginning and our Customer Solution Engineering team is pivotal in sustaining our rapid growth across the globe. We are looking for a highly collaborative, outcome-oriented Customer Solution Engineer, to help us bring home the technical win and take on this huge market opportunity.

  

Working hand in hand with our Account Executives, you'll solve some of the most interesting business-critical challenges and transformations. You'll focus on prospects and customers; helping them embrace digital transformation, to be disruptors, and avoid being disrupted. As the CEO aka "ZEO" of your domain, you'll become an expert on the entire quote-to-cash cycle for enterprise businesses across any sales channel. You'll leverage your technical prowess to knock out the competition and demonstrate how Zuora allows the world's largest companies to unlock new growth in the new world of total monetization.

  

This is a remote position, so you'll be working remotely while occasionally getting together with your team for office visits, events, or offsites. Of course, you're welcome to come into the office more often if you're nearby.

  

What you'll do

* Complete Zuora's in-depth onboarding and sales training to become an expert in Zuora's products, services, unique solutions, and technical capabilities
* Own the technical relationships with a deep understanding of customer needs and constraints
* Own adoption and the technical health of the customer
* Deliver product demonstrations and technical presentations to a C-Level audience and articulate how Zuora's platform will allow their business to succeed and grow
* Create end-to-end use case-specific demonstrations mapped to prospects' strategic objectives across industries
* Secure technical wins by differentiating Zuora against the competition, handle technical objections and mitigate any concerns that might block a deal from closing
* Act as the front-line liaison to our product management team by informing our product roadmap based on prospects' needs
* Own making sure the customer is realizing value against their expectations
* Responsible for defining & monitoring the business case and KPIs in the account plan
* Help shape commercial strategy and technical action plan
* Help identify white space including the extension of our footprint & capabilities and expansion into new BUs
* Commercially present solutions in easy-to-grasp ways
* Coordinate resources from across Zuora & partners from a technical standpoint
* Work with product & solution management to share the context (why) behind customer requests and potential applicability to others in a segment
* Manage escalations internally and externally with support from AEs and Customer Support to identify a root cause and action plan
* Ask for customer reference after milestones are delivered, with follow-up support from AEs and customer advocacy
* Collaborate with solution architects in overall design and approach
* Support sales and marketing at field events with product demonstrations and technical subject matter expertise
* Respond to technical elements of RFI's / RFP's
* Travel throughout your sales territory

  

Your experience

* 3+ years of relevant experience in Sales Engineering (presales, solution consultant, solution architect)
* Self-motivation and the desire to learn and become an expert on the entire quote-to-cash cycle for enterprise businesses across any sales channel in The Subscription Economy
* Excellent presentation skills and the ability to drive discussions for both small and large groups within organizations
* Strong business value selling experience and familiarity with SaaS and Cloud technology
* An understanding of subscription and recurring revenue business models
* Experience working with a diligent sales process methodology (MEDDIC, Value Selling, etc.)
* General understanding of API development and various coding languages (php, ruby, java, etc.)
* Bachelor's Degree and/or relevant FinTech experience

  

#ZEOLife at Zuora

As an industry pioneer, our work is constantly evolving and challenging us in new ways that require us to think differently, iterate often and learn constantly—it's exciting. Our people, whom we refer to as "ZEOs" are empowered to take on a mindset of ownership and make a bigger impact here. Our teams collaborate deeply, exchange different ideas openly and together we're making what's next possible for our customers, community and the world.

  

As part of our commitment to building an inclusive, high-performance culture where ZEOs feel inspired, connected and valued, we support ZEOs with:

* Competitive compensation, corporate bonus program and performance rewards, and retirement programs
* Medical, dental and vision insurance
* Generous, flexible time off
* Paid holidays, "wellness" days and company wide end of year break
* 6 months fully paid parental leave
* Learning & Development stipend
* Opportunities to volunteer and give back, including charitable donation match
* Free resources and support for your mental wellbeing

  

Specific benefits offerings may vary by country and can be viewed in more detail during your interview process.

  

Location & Work Arrangements

Organizations and teams at Zuora are empowered to design efficient and flexible ways of working, being intentional about scheduling, communication, and collaboration strategies that help us achieve our best results. In our dynamic, globally distributed company, this means balancing flexibility and responsibility — flexibility to live our lives to the fullest, and responsibility to each other, to our customers, and to our shareholders. For most roles, we offer the flexibility to work both remotely and at Zuora offices.

  

Our Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace

Think, be and do you! At Zuora, different perspectives, experiences and contributions matter. Everyone counts. Zuora is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating an inclusive environment for all.

  

Zuora does not discriminate on the basis of, and considers individuals seeking employment with Zuora without regards to, race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

  

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)zuora.com.

title: Technical Solutions Consultant, Video Ads, gTech Ads Sellside
description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: **New York, NY, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA**.

### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* Experience coding with one or more programming languages (e.g., Java, Python, C++).
* Experience working with client-side web technologies (e.g., XML, HTTP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
* Experience in technical troubleshooting, and managing internal/external partners or customers.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business, or a related field.
* 2 years of experience working with database technologies (e.g., SQL, NoSQL).
* 2 years of customer-facing experience in product implementations, technical solutions consulting, or technical business.
* 2 years of experience with the Ads ecosystem, Google Apps Manager, business generation options for display and video, and video related technologies.
* Experience troubleshooting Over-the-Top (OTT) streaming devices and supporting large broadcasters in live streaming or developer operations position.
* Ability to absorb technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience.

**About the job**
-----------------

gTech Ads is responsible for all support and media and technical services for customers big and small across our entire Ad products stack. We help our customers get the most out of our Ad and Publisher products and guide them when they need help. We provide a range of services from enabling better self help and in-product support, to providing better support through interactions, setting up accounts and implementing ad campaigns, and providing media solutions for customers business and marketing needs and providing complex technical and measurement solutions along with consultative support for our large customers. These solutions range from bespoke and customized ones for our customers to scalable support for millions of customers worldwide. Based on the evolving needs of our ads customers, we partner with Sales, Product and Engineering teams within Google to develop better solutions, tools, and services to improve our products and enhance our client experience. As a cross-functional and global team, we ensure our customers get the best return on investment with Google and we remain a trusted partner.

  

gTech Ads Sellside takes a customer centric, creative, and collaborative approach to provide foundational services and forward-looking business solutions to advertiser and publisher customers. Through technical implementations, optimizations, and key solutions, gTech Ads Sellside's product/solution experts help customers attain their business goals while building long-term capabilities.  
  
gPS Video Streaming Specialist (VSS) team is at the forefront of video innovation, paving the way for the future of TV. VSS are OTT streaming experts supporting Dynamic Ad Insertion (DAI) and ad serving for Google’s largest Video and Broadcaster partners.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.  
  
To learn more about gTech, check out our video.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $97,500-$140,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Help partners (video publishers) in their day-to-day challenges by providing consultation, delivering innovative and scalable solutions, and conducting technical troubleshooting to their problems and pain points.
* Provide troubleshooting support for Google’s dynamic dd insertion business as part of a global team (may include rotations on nights/weekends as business demands) to ensure prompt resolution of customer-impacting technical issues.
* Assist clients in the adoption of new products via upgrades and migrations to develop their long term success and provide client feedback on features to Product Management and Engineering.
* Guarantee the technical aspects of client integrations (both new and ongoing) by providing necessary documentation and technical guidance.
* Work with large, complex data sets. Conduct end-to-end analyses that include data gathering and requirements specification, exploratory data analysis, model development, and delivery of results to business partners and executives.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Junior Solutions Engineer
description:
**WHO WE ARE**

At KNAPP (pronounced K-NAP, not Nap!), we “Make Complexity Simple” by offering intelligent solutions for digitizing and automating everything from production and distribution to the last mile and stores. We are the customer’s value tech chain partner, which means partnering with the customer to create the most value within each link in their supply chain. Leveraging the latest software, AI and Robotics technology, we continue to disrupt the logistics automation industry for the world’s industry leaders in grocery, healthcare, retail, e-commerce, apparel & manufacturing.  
  
We are a global company with our US headquarters located just North of Atlanta in Kennesaw, GA. KNAPP specializes in automated solutions for both WMS (Warehouse Management Systems) and WCS (Warehouse Control Systems) for B2B (Business to Business) and B2C (Business to Consumer) customers. We are a growing company of over 7,200 employees worldwide and in over 50 countries that is privately held, with 7% of our revenue reinvested in R&D, ensuring a strong and vibrant future! Join us and see how you can help change the world! For more information, visit www.knapp.com..

**WHAT YOU GET TO DO**

The holder of this position is a member of the Solutions Engineering team at KNAPP Logistics & Automation. This position requires excellent communication skills (both written and verbal), strong analytical skills, and a basic knowledge of warehousing/distribution logistics concepts. The primary objectives of this position are:

* Support other solutions engineers on KNAPP’s material handling projects in the sales phase to create feasible, competitive solutions for our customers and potential customers
* Work on the development of fundamental analysis tools to increase KNAPP’s efficiency in the realm of data analysis using capabilities related to SQL and programming to build scripts for calculations and report generation.

**Essential Functions and Responsibilities****:**

* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  + Capable of developing clear, concise PowerPoint presentations
  + Capable of working in cross functional teams
  + Most importantly, the junior solutions engineer needs to be proactive in communicating when they reach road blocks and need help to move forward è ask questions and get help immediately when a situation arises or a problem that you do not know how to deal with
* Strong analytical skills
  + Capable of using mathematics to solve problems related to storage location mixtures, container flow mixtures, and other design values for warehousing designs, e.g. conveyor flows, storage locations within an AS/RS or goods-to-person system, determine rough box size usages, etc.
  + Highly competent in spreadsheet analyses, database mining, etc. Examining order structures for advantages in processing
* Developing throughput projections for different material handling units such as pallets, cases, totes, outbound cartons, order lines, units, cube, etc.
  + Exponentially compounding model development
  + Linear regression model development with/without seasonality
* Data mining of client databases for order structure and potential picking methods to take advantage of those order structures by profiling them to certain picking technologies and methodologies
  + Familiar with all types of queries: select, update, crosstab, etc.
  + SQL is a definite plus as well as experience in MySQL, Foxpro, Oracle, etc. With SQL capability, the junior solutions engineer will spend a considerable amount of time working on prescripted tools for database analysis
* Capable of programming in Java, C++, or development of macros in Visual Basic, etc. in order to aid in performing waving and batching scenario analysis and order completion analysis by SKU profiling
  + This programming capability may also be deployed in the development of the SQL based data analysis tool that is to be built in an on-going continuous improvement manner.
* Return on investment (ROI) calculations
  + Quick calculations to drive toward determination of feasible designs
  + Detailed calculations to provide customers with cash flows and head counts
  + Detailed understanding of commonly used financial metrics such as IRR, NPV, Simple Payback Period, MACRS/depreciation, etc.
  + Ability to make layouts using the VectorWorks program and in-house tools.
    - This will be a core training that occurs for the junior solutions engineer.
    - Ability to make minor modifications to layouts in AutoCAD for layout gaming purposes is a definite plus
* Basic knowledge of warehousing/distribution logistics concepts and trade-offs is a plus, but this is mostly expected to be learned as one works in the junior solutions engineering position. Over time, develop an understanding of:
  + Product identification, barcoding, and tracking throughout the warehouse
  + Product conveyability, conveyor flow capabilities/dynamics, and typical use of conveyor technologies and applications
  + Automated storage systems
  + Knowledge of picking technologies such as voice, PTL, goods-to-person, A-frames, unit sorters and the different methods of deployment of each technology
  + Common picking strategies such as batch, cluster, discrete, etc. and associated pros and cons of each
  + Forklift and order picking equipment and performance rates is a plus but not a necessity
  + Operational strategies commonly deployed in warehousing
  + Inventory strategies commonly deployed in warehousing

**Other Duties and Responsibilities****:**

* The workplace is a team environment normally consisting of Salespeople, Solutions Engineers, and Systems Engineers. At a high level, here is a description of these roles:

* **Salespeople** – KNAPP is in the business of selling material handling solutions for warehousing, distribution, and occasionally for kitting/production systems; therefore, we have salespeople that identify project opportunities and manage the commercial and relationship aspects of a project
* **Solutions Engineers** – use mathematics and process improvements to develop the required and business case-supportable equipment sets and requirements for world class material handling solutions; also responsible for supporting salespeople on site as needed through the design and quotation process. Junior solutions engineers will not do this very often, but it is KNAPP’s goal to identify strong juniors who would be interested and capable to take on first-hand involvement with customers as soon as deemed possible by management.

* A goal of a junior solutions engineer is to become a solutions engineer as soon as possible, then once a solutions engineer, the goal becomes to grow into a senior solutions engineer, and then on to vertical/industry group leader within the department.

* **Systems Engineers** – responsible for the CAD/VectorWorks layouts of designed solutions and generating pricing lists for those solutions.

* On a project basis, interface with other Solutions Engineering leads and the System Engineering group (mechanical engineers) to develop a working material handling solution for proposal generation and presentation to clients
* Interface with KNAPP Austria (Graz) resources (mechanical and software engineers) to outline key deliverables and pinch points that are critical to projects from both the client’s perspective and from a material handling perspective; this communication will often be led by the Solutions Engineering lead in most cases and should serve as valuable learning for the junior solutions engineer
* Develop supporting documentation, charts, graphs, etc. for proposals and internal design purposes
  + Forecasting of throughputs
  + Forecasting of inventory
  + Flow diagrams
  + Process diagrams
  + Process descriptions
  + Functionality requirements specification
  + Build presentations outlining key points and areas of the proposed solutions
  + Key design assumptions and parameters

**WHAT YOU HAVE**

* B.S. or M.S. Industrial Engineering or other logistics-related major, 2.50 GPA or higher
* Experience in logistics and/or warehousing is a plus but is not required
* Certification and/or training in lean or six sigma is a plus but is not required
* Software deployed: IBM Lotus Notes, MS Office suite including Excel, Access, Word, Visio, PowerPoint; Adobe Acrobat, Oracle(desired), VectorWorks (basics), AutoCAD (basics), Mini-tab (desired/occasional), JCreator (desired/occasional)
  + It is expected that the junior solutions engineer will learn the required software applications on the job

**Working Conditions and Environment****:**

* Occasional travel required, generally estimated at 10%-20%.
* Ability to travel by air domestically (US)
* Ability to travel internationally is a plus but is likely unnecessary (primarily Austria and other parts of Europe as well as Canada)
* At times, travel to Europe may demand a 1 to 2 week trip, typically occurring 1 to 2 times per year
* Professional office etiquette is required at all times
* Strong work ethic and self-motivated behavior are required
* High ethical values and behaviors are required in performing all functions:
  + Openly tell the truth
  + Take the well-being of others into account at all times
  + Be considerate and respectful to all colleagues and customers
* Document all key project information in detail and in truth.
* Physical requirements: sitting for extended periods of time, walking, reading, listening, and finger dexterity for keyboarding, visual acuity, reaching with arms' extended.

**WHAT YOU WILL GET**

* 2 remote days per week
* Half day Fridays
* A beautiful new, state-of-the-art, office complex in Kennesaw, GA
* Industry competitive compensation
* Great benefits with better than average employer contributions, including health, dental, vision, life insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts, Short & Long Term Disability and more!
* 401k with a very generous employer match and no vesting!
* Paid Vacation & Holidays
* Profit Sharing
* Paid Parental Leave
* Subsidized Daycare
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Pet Insurance
* Subsidized food delivery
* Monthly celebrations
* Quarterly employee events
* Corporate Social Responsibility including recycling, sustainability and volunteering

*KNAPP is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a work environment that supports, inspires, and respects all individuals without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran, disability status or any other basis protected by law.*

*Due to the safety-sensitive nature of this position, strict adherence to KNAPP’s drug-free workplace policy is required. All candidates will be subject to drug-screening in accordance with the policy and will be expected to remain drug-free during their employment. There will be no exception if recreational or medical use of marijuana is permitted in the location of employment and/or residence or if use of marijuana is only during “off-hours.”*
